cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SE of Fort Lauderdale, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to parallel the southeast Florida coast Sunday, then turn north-northwest and accelerate north-northeast along the U.S. East Coast toward the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic, eventually passing near the Delaware Valley and New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina / North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches currently confined to the Florida–Georgia coast; none yet issued for the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings from Boca Raton FL to the Volusia/Flagler County line FL; tropical-storm warnings north of Ocean Reef FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida through New England, including the Delaware Bay and New Jersey shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with gusts to near 50 mph) possible late Tuesday into early Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding of 1–3 ft possible along the tidal Delaware River and nearby New Jersey coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–5 inches of rain with localized amounts to 6 inches could cause flash and urban flooding in the Philadelphia area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated waves may restrict vessel movements at entrance channels; brief river flooding on smaller tributaries possible
